intro: Corydalis tibeto-oppositifolia, commonly known as the Tibetan oppositeleaf Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves arranged oppositely along the stems, giving it its common name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
